actions.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Criminal Justice.

official_title: A bill to amend the Victims of Crime Act of 1984 to provide for assistance to certain individuals who are injured or die while preventing crime or apprehending criminals, and for other purposes.
subjects: Federal aid to law enforcement agencies

summary.text: Good Samaritan Assistance Act of 1985 - Amends the Victims of Crime Act of 1984 to authorize the Attorney General to make annual grants from the Crime Victims Fund to eligible good samaritan reward programs. Sets forth a formula to determine the amount of the grant. Makes a program eligible to receive grants if such program: (1) is operated by a State and offers rewards to good samaritans and their survivors; (2) certifies that grants will not be used to supplant State funds otherwise available to provide such award; (3) meets certain requirements imposed with respect to compensation to victims of crimes; and (4) is not an entitlement program. Defines "good samaritan" for purposes of this Act as an individual who acted voluntarily and nonnegligently to prevent a crime, apprehend a suspected offender, preserve the public peace, or prevent a public disturbance.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Victims of Crime Act of 1984 to provide for assistance to certain individuals who are injured or die while preventing crime or apprehending criminals, and for other purposes.
